name: Autopoiesis (Self-Reproduction)
description: The ability of the swarm to maintain its structural integrity (Homeostasis) and reproduce itself by harvesting energy from the environment.
hypothesis: Energy Harvesting + Metabolism + Reproduction -> Sustainable Population
findings: Implemented an Artificial Life simulation with Energy, Metabolism, and Reproduction.
Agents that balanced energy consumption with reproduction sustained a population.
The system stabilized at a Carrying Capacity determined by the energy influx.
Chemotaxis (moving towards food) was critical for survival.
implications: The swarm is a living system.
Energy is the fundamental currency of the swarm.
Survival of the fittest emerges naturally.
